item.title: Racket: Wiring it up to a REPL ala SLIME/Swank
item.description: One of the awesome things about working with clojure is that it’s possible to wire up clojure files in emacs to a REPL by making use of Slime/https://github.com/technomancy/swank-clojure[Swank]. I’ve started using Racket to work through the examples in The Little Schemer and wanted to achieve a similar thing there. Racket is a modern programming language in the Lisp/Scheme family, suitable for a wide range of applications I don’t know much about configuring emacs so I made use of Phil Halgelberg’s emacs-starter-kit which is available on github.
